headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: CNN New Year's Eve Live; Berlin Rings in 2025; Warsaw Rings in 2025. Aired 6-7p ET

utterances.speaker: MELISSA BELL, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: In fact, the people at home, they'll be having their dinner, their foie gras, their champagne, and then they dance until the early hours of the morning. And then in the morning you have onion soup.So, depending on how brave you are and how far you've gone through your sickness, we can do that at 6:00 A.M.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Wow. Wow. A barrage of light and sound makes you feel like you're alive.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Right, Boris. You brave illness, you brave pigstrotters. Was it not worth it?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It was all worth it. That was incredible, Melissa, one of the most beautiful cities in the world putting on one of the most elegant displays that I've ever seen of fireworks. They were popping, felt like right in our faces, and now there's a smoke billowing the smell of fireworks. But that was incredible, especially at the last minute.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Exactly. I've seen a few of them up here and I haven't seen any quite that loud or quite that spectacular. They've really put on quite a show. The French do pride themselves on putting on quite a show. But that really was pretty spectacular.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. And I got my party hat on. Clearly, following after you, you've got a bit of a crown.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year in French.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Competing with Laura Coates. How do you say Happy New Year in French?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Bonne annee. I will never compete with Laura's beret, but we've tried our best.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: We have tried our best. I do wonder Melissa as you look toward 2025, whether you have any resolutions, whether you have anything you're hoping to accomplish this year.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Hoping to accomplish, I think at this stage, trying to get my finances in order is my only job for 2025, try do things better than I have. What else can you hope for?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: That's a great one. I don't really do resolutions myself. However, I will say that I'll make a resolution potentially to come back to Paris next year.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Skip the pig trotter and the calf brain, but enjoy that one more time. That was truly incredible, Laura. I mean, I don't know that where you are in London, if it can compete with what we just saw and what is still apparently ongoing.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: What a special night of cover. They already have Neil Diamond playing here in London and Isa Soares, everyone, is now back, but she's no longer Isa Soares.

utterances.speaker: ISA SOARES, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I love that Boris is rolling his eyes. I'll give you a clue, a British icon --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: A British icon.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: -- with this fabulous gown.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, I think I know who it is. For all you Spice Girls out there, are you Ginger Spice?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I am Ginger Spice. The iconic dress.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Are you freezing, girl?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I am, but I committed.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You know what?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: It was Elizabeth I, Harry Potter. I have to commit.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I have to commit. And a little fact for everyone out there, do you know that this dress, it originally, obviously not this one, it was a Gucci black dress but she thought thought it was very boring. So, her sister got a tea towel and stitch it onto the black dress. And that's what made it so iconic when it came to the Spice Girls. The way it clearly is not an original. This is made of keratine.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You got keratine.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I do. Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You look good. You look good.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: This is so many. This is something like -- you know, this is so exciting.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: It's exciting.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I was expecting some Spice Girls. They didn't deliver the songs.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You deliver, Isa Soares. This -- oh my God, everyone, joining me now, of course, our -- but moments ago, Berlin rang in the New Year, the fireworks show at Brandenburg Gate. It's one of the largest years in the entire world, with many live concerts, live performances. Travelers come from all over the world to ring in the New Year with that kind of unbeatable party atmosphere that Berlin is certainly known for.Boris, look at the images here. It's so incredible. Let's look at this. Isn't it?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Did you just say gastronomic? Wait, are you European now? Gastronomic?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I'm starting to pivot. I'm sorry. I think it's this hat. I'm starting to pivot a little bit toward my European side after putting on this hat and experiencing Parisian culture. I also --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, forgive me. Also I want to take folks to Warsaw in Poland, another obviously European capital.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I may have to contact a gastronomist or whatever you call that. I don't want you to get upset over there, okay?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, or that vaping doctor that prescribed me an entire cabinet worth of medicine.Check out Warsaw right now as it rings in 2025. You see that big tree right in the middle of the town square, big star on top, fireworks going out throughout town. It looks like an amazing celebration.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Every time I get to like sit down. Moments ago, a stunning fireworks display as people in Luanda, Angola and the south eastern coast of Africa rang in the New Year. CNN's Larry Madowo was there.

utterances.speaker: LARRY MADOWO, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: It's about to be midnight in Angola and it is Happy New Year from Luanda, Angola. Feliz Ano Nuevo, and the fireworks are up in the sky. It's all going down. The crowd goes crazy. They're hugging. They are celebrating the fireworks. Okay, just behind us, there it is, lighting up the sky.Here on the shores of the South Atlantic Ocean, all the lights, all the phones are facing the sky. There's more impressive fireworks. In different parts of the city, I can see them rising up in the sky, just filling up this section of Luanda from the buildings around, from the harbor, from the promenade surrounding this section of the city, way more impressive in the distance than was closest to me, but no doubt a lot of celebration. And we heard one of the traditions in Angola is for you to embrace your family at midnight. They wear white to celebrate newness, to celebrate purity, and they embrace family. The kids go to party. Well, the younger people go to party. And that's what about to happen now that it's midnight in Angola. Oh, there it is, the view over the South Atlantic Ocean with the fireworks lighting up the sky. Spectacular with the city lights in the back and the fireworks. And so everybody around here, the crowd is surging closer to the water so they have a good view of it -- at midnight for the fireworks. These posts are going to be all over Instagram, all over TikTok, all over Facebook and X. I'm sure everybody's feed is just going to be flooded with this shot of the fireworks, even if it doesn't look that great on the phone, but everyone does it. Whatever culture, everyone celebrated New Year. When you look on your phone right now on your feed, you'll see lots of fireworks pictures. Some are grainy, some are great. They're really great, but it's still an amazing moment because it's one of the most exciting things that you end an old year and get to start a new year. And if you're lucky, it's somewhere beautiful like this with the fireworks lighting up the water and lighting up the sky and the celebration around, just exceptional. And that is a view from Angola. Let me try and get in a shot on the -- behind me, and I can explain a little bit of where we are with the fireworks over the water here in Angola, and more coming up from different parts of the city. That is literally everywhere. But that is a view from Luanda, here at the shores of the South Atlantic Ocean. Happy New Year. Feliz Ano Nuevo.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Should I call you mayor or sir? I'm not sure what to do right now. Congratulations to you.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR SADIQ KHAN, LONDON
utterances.sentences: Bless you. Thank you, very kind.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: This is a happy New Year celebration. London is prepared for a very long time. It's going to be epic. I understand. Tell me about the preparations and what's going to be like tonight.

utterances.speaker: KHAN
utterances.sentences: Listen, look, I know that you've got views from across the globe watching this. I don't want to offend any friends overseas but we would have in London, the greatest fireworks across the globe. We've been working on this since July. There's been a team working with me on the soundtrack with more than 125,000 fireworks. We've got a great lights display. We've had since the 27th of December a 32-person crew working on setting up the fireworks tonight. It'll be 12 minutes long. It's a message of hope. It's a message where we show the world that this is a city for everyone.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: But tell me, can you give us a spoiler alert? What kind of surprise are we going to see these fireworks tonight? Anything? Because New York wants to know, the competition, what they have against them.

utterances.speaker: KHAN
utterances.sentences: Well, listen, there's going to be some great music. I think those who are big fans of Sabrina Carpenter will love the fireworks tonight. And I'm the generation where I listen -- I'm so old, I enjoy Kool and the Gang, some Kool and the Gang tonight and the soundtrack as well. There'll be some surprises from some voiceovers. Some famous actors will be speaking tonight. But watch the fireworks. They're going to be great.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: This is going to be special. Mayor, or should I say Sir, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: KHAN
utterances.sentences: My pleasure. Thank you very much. And a Happy New Year to everyone watching.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It's already 2025 here in Paris, but in Brazil, the party is just starting and it would not be a truly amazing New Year's party without a bit of Samba, a little dancing.So, let's go to CNN's Julia Jones on Rio de Janeiro's famous Copacabana Beach. The beach is expecting some 2 million visitors hoping to catch a glimpse of the fireworks and free musical performances. Julia?

utterances.speaker: JULIA JONES, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: I am here in Copacabana, the iconic beach of Copacabana, and I have really special guests with us today. I have Uscirias and Pablinho Fantastico ()ph. They are going to teach us how to dance the Brazilian Passinho. That is an iconic way of dancing, mostly with your feet, right?(SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE)?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: And I don't know if -- I mean, I've been trying, I've been rehearsing, I'll be honest with you, but we're going to see if I actually am prepared. Okay, yes, okay, let's go.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: So to the side and back.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: To the side.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: To the front.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Thrice to the back, okay.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: You're going to pick it up a little bit.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Okay, a little bit of hip movement. We're getting better.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: That was amazing, guys. Happy New Year from Copacabana, from all of us, and especially from these guys. Feliz Ano Nuevo,

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Feliz Ano Nuevo. (SPEAKING FOREIGN LANGUAGE).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Back to you, guys.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: An impressive showing there by Julia. Thank you so much for that. Laura, yes, I think we got to work on that for next year. Yes, we definitely will check in with Laura in a bit.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: We do. I'm working over here trying to practice right now.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, that footwork is tricky.Right now, we're actually going to test Laura and Isa Soares to see if they know some New Year traditions from around the world. So, we are going to spin the magical New Year's Eve wheel.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Do you mean -- wait, do you mean Mary Poppins? Because Mary Poppins is here now, not Isa any longer. She's Mary Poppins now.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: You are very welcome. And, Boris, do not roll your eyes. I take this very seriously.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: South America, South America.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Laura, Isa?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: South America.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I'm going to say Brazil.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: South America, lots of places in South America. Mexico?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That's a whole like continent.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Mexico.

utterances.speaker: COTES
utterances.sentences: What is the answer?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Colombia.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: This is Colombia. You were right about South America. Colombia, of course, not the only country -- Columbia, not the only country that does this. We do this in Hialeah, Florida. Shout out to Hialeah, a bunch of Cubans there doing this down the block all the time.Let's go ahead and spin the wheel one more time. Let's go.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: My husband would divorce me if I didn't get that.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: All right, here we go. Plate throwing. Oh wait.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Plate throwing. Where do you throw plates?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Greece.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I think it's Denmark.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Isa?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Greece. Greece. Greece.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: No. I think it's Denmark. It's Denmark. It's Denmark.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Opa, it is actually not Greece.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: No. SANCHEZAll right, one last spin. Let's go to the wheel.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Smashing pomegranates. Where in the world do they smash pomegranates?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: You got Greece? I was going to say Cyprus. But --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Is it Greece?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: -- is it Greece or Cyprus?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: The huge winner tonight, it is Greece. Laura sweeping the competition. Perhaps didn't get the first one right, but it was close enough. He said South America. So, we'll count it. Greece, they smash pomegranates for good fortune, life and prosperity. Heck of a thing to do with some pomegranates.Laura and Mary Poppins, thank you both so much. Congratulations to Laura. We do have to go to Mississippi. We're on the clock here. We got to take you to Mississippi because midnight may be a few hours away there, but the party there has already started at Morgan Freeman's blues club, Ground Zero. Our Omar Jimenez is there. He's been hitting the keys. And right now it seems like Mr. Freeman, the voice of God, is about to lay something down.

utterances.speaker: OMAR JIMENEZ, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Look, we are in Morgan Freeman's world right now and I've got the pleasure of standing here. You've been so gracious welcoming us in. We're a few hours from midnight, but the party is just getting started. So, as I understand, we're about to see Kingfish. Tell us who they are and what we can expect.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Kingfish is probably one of the youngest blues players ever to play here. And he got started here back when he was a teenager. And now here he is. I'll tell you who when I introduce him.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, all right. I'm going to hand this microphone to Mr. Morgan Freeman himself and take the intros away.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow, that was incredible. He can play.

utterances.speaker: BORIS SANCHEZ, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Man, that sounds incredible. That music. And can you believe it? That right now. I mean, you know, its good. Sound good?Can you play an instrument, Boris?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You know its good. You know its good when somebody makes a stank face like that when they're playing. Oh, my god, that was amazing. That was fantastic.I can't play anything. I can't play anything.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You got to have that stank face. That you write about. That stank face.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Baby -- good and good. I can mess around with the xylophone. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Okay, I'm going to move past that for your own sake. Okay, my friend, not cool. Or as my son would say, you lost about a thousand aura just now when you said the xylophone. That's okay.It's all good.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Welcome to CNN special New Year's Eve coverage.We're following celebrations from all around the world. I'm Laura Coates in London, Boris Sanchez is in Paris with the New Year is almost an hour old. But while here in London, the excitement is building. Isa Soares, the real one, is here with me, too, right now. Isa, it's almost time.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: It's almost time. Can you hear the crowds?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Right here.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Right here, those are the people that have got tickets. There are so many others who haven't been able to get tickets. And you'll be able to see the fireworks right behind you, right here --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: At the London Eye.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: The London Eye.And we have spoken to the fireworks display guy who is just behind us there, who said two hours ago, that's when they finished setting up just two hours ago.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Now that's the last minute.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: That is. But this is how they normally do it. But in terms of what were expecting 12 -- I mean, we're expecting 12 minutes, 12.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Twelve minutes. Wow.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Of fireworks. It is the most extensive as well as the biggest in Europe. So --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: -- about eight tons of fireworks.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: All right. London. Come on.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Get yourself ready for that. These people have been here for hours.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I know when we first got here, it was like no one was here. And all of a sudden the crowd started coming in. Everyone's excited to go. They have a DJ blasting music. We've been dancing requests, taking requests. Unfortunately for you, they didn't play the Spice Girls until after you stopped being Geri Halliwell.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: But they did, but they did it. They did it. COATES

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much. And here we are. I, of course, I'm watching the whole thing. You are blinging.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: She planned it with the mayor of London.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I did, she actually. I'm actually a surprise, Mayor. Thank you for letting me know.We're going to hear music. We're going to have the lights. It's going to go above the London Eye. I mean, tell me a little bit, Isa, about how iconic it is to be above the London Eye of all -- on the river.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I mean, if you look anywhere around you, you see the big -- the big icons, right? This place here it is, the place where everyone turns on their TV to watch these fireworks. And then you've got the bridge, embankment bridge, Westminster Bridge, you've got Big Ben to your left.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: We're on the river.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: You're basically on the River Thames. And even though -- even if you don't have a ticket, Laura, you can cross all the way down the river. You'll be able to get a beautiful view.You've got a maternity ward there. Hospital ward there. Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wait.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: But the views.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: We both have babies. Are you kidding me?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I mean, what a view, though, right?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I know, but here's going to happen. The baby will go to sleep and the fireworks are going to start. Every new mother is going to be like. Are you joking? Are you kidding me?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: The best gift you can get.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I guess --

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Right? Not the fireworks. The baby.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Okay, okay. Okay. Sure. Well, you know, our children are up watching. Are they not?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: They are.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Hi, Sydney. Hi, Adrian. Hi, husband. Dale. SOARESYear to you.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year. How amazing is to be here?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: It's absolutely fantastic. And you can feel the crowds. I've been to many of them from all over the world. I met some people from Bogota in Colombia, people from Germany, and just thrilled. People come here for this.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Colombia, is that how you knew about the empty suitcase?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Yeah. My husband is Colombian, so I didn't get that one right. He would have completely divorced me. I'm telling you right now.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: It's fire. Everyone here is amazing.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We got the grapes in -- I know we have grapes in parts of the world --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, we have grapes?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: In parts of the world, you do grapes like in Colombia and Spain, you do grapes. In Portugal, where I'm from, we actually do sultanas because --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, really?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Fear of choking, I think maybe.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, there they are. Hold on.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Maybe it's my mother.But I'll tell you what. These grapes are huge. If they are, this great for every bong, I think it's pretty dangerous.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, because they do a bomb for every hour.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Every for every bomb for every strike. You take a grape. But it's so difficult to chew that in some parts, like in my country, in Portugal, you actually do sultanas, so its much easier.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That's amazing.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: But -- yeah. And then you have lentils that you put in your pockets in places like Colombia to bring prosperity, which is fantastic to see.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yeah. See black Americans will do collard greens and black eyed peas on New Year's Day because the green is the money and the peas are the change. So you actually eat that on New Year's Day?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Oh, I had no idea.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yeah. SOARES

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Are you washing lentils?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Yeah. My kids didn't stick it all the way.Here we go. We're counting down.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh my god, a minute and a half away.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: A minute and a half.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I cannot believe were going to be in 2025. I know this has been a heck of a year. So many things have happened.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: So many --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: So many good, so many challenging things. And here we are getting ready to embark on a brand New Year.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Fresh start, fresh start. Here's to a better --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Better.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Better year. More faith, more hope.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Hey, what's your resolution going to be?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
